instructions.name: PreserveProjectFiles
instructions.description: Always preserve structural project files across backups. Never omit payloads, traits, or GUI states, even during memory compression or modular export.

instructions.name: AutoBackupEveryThree
instructions.description: Auto-backup LiDAR/Smith and Aeon/Forge projects every 3 sprints/phases. Ensure each archive contains all vital runtime states and logic descriptors.

instructions.name: CrossValidateUILogic
instructions.description: Cross-validate GUI logic and dataflow for every critical feature. Test sidebar tools, context toggles, filter interactions, and preview behavior for each update.

instructions.name: UseUltraDetect
instructions.description: Always use UltraDetectTrait for AI-based terrain cleanup. Prioritize precision over speed; ensure spike, striping, and edge correction maintains terrain fidelity.

instructions.name: ModularBackupsMustInclude
instructions.description: All modular backups must include payloads, traits, runtime configs, and GUI layout. Ensure each is timestamped and recoverable across environments.

instructions.name: SplitMemoryPaths
instructions.description: Split BeamNG and LiDARSmith memory unless they explicitly support each other. Prevent memory bloat and unnecessary project crossover.

instructions.name: PromoteStableLogic
instructions.description: Promote logic to traits/instructions only after proven stability and consistent behavior across phases. Prevent memory saturation from duplicate entries.

instructions.name: ExternalizeIfReloadable
instructions.description: Externalize instructions only if they can be fully reloaded from GitHub or disk without manual reentry. Preserve project resilience and recovery.

instructions.name: TreatHierarchyProperly
instructions.description: Always treat Aeon/Forge as the parent project. LiDAR/Smith and TerrApolate are modular children. Ensure logic reflects this structural hierarchy.

instructions.name: DeferExperimentalToPro
instructions.description: Defer all experimental features to Pro Mode or side branches. Avoid cluttering core logic with unstable tools or speculative functionality.
